summary: This is an email exchange between U.S. Attorney's Office (Southern District of New York) staff regarding draft memos (DP memos). The primary suggestion is to emphasize that others were more culpable and that it is unfair to hold only two individuals responsible for Jeffrey Epstein's death.

persons.name: Unknown Sender
persons.context: Sends an email with suggestions for draft memos (DP memos), arguing it's unfair to hold only two people responsible for Epstein's death.

persons.name: Unknown Recipient
persons.context: Receives the email and is asked to take the lead on the draft memos; the sender provides editing suggestions.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to in the context of his death and the discussion of culpability for it.

events.title: Discussion of Culpability for Epstein's Death
events.description: Internal email discussion within the U.S. Attorney's Office about draft memos arguing that others were more culpable and it is unfair to hold only two individuals responsible for Jeffrey Epstein's death.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York dated April 16, 2021.
It discusses draft memos (DP memos) concerning culpability for Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The primary suggestion is to argue that others were more culpable and that holding only two individuals responsible is unfair.
The correspondence indicates planned further discussion via phone call about the memos.
